medical_history.chief_complaint: 1-year history of an itchy facial rash, productive cough, and progressive dyspnea for the preceding 2 weeks.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The facial rash began 1 year prior to presentation, initially diagnosed as allergic contact dermatitis and later as systemic lupus erythematosus. The rash spread from the face to the scalp and neck. The cough and dyspnea started 2 weeks before the visit, with no improvement after treatment with prednisone and hydroxychloroquine.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Alcohol use disorder, anxiety, depression, hypothyroidism, and fatty liver disease.
medical_history.family_history: Rheumatoid arthritis in her mother and father, and systemic lupus erythematosus in her maternal aunt.
medical_history.social_history: Unemployed, active smoker with a 42 pack-year history, and consumes 10 beers nightly.
